skill.name: matchms
skill.description: Mass spectrometry analysis. Process mzML/MGF/MSP, spectral similarity (cosine, modified cosine), metadata harmonization, compound ID, for metabolomics and MS data processing.
skill.summary: Mass spectrometry analysis. Process mzML/MGF/MSP, spectral similarity (cosine, modified cosine), met...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown guides and code examples for the matchms Python library. No executable code, no credential access, no network exfiltration. Pure prompt-based guidance.

content.value_statement: You need to process mass spectrometry data and identify compounds. This skill provides guided workflows for importing, filtering, and scoring spectra using the matchms library.
actual_capabilities: Load spectra from MGF, mzML, MSP, JSON, and USI formats.
Apply default filters, normalization, and peak selection.
Compute cosine, modified cosine, and neutral loss similarities.
Build SpectrumProcessor pipelines for repeatable workflows.
Export processed spectra to MGF, MSP, and JSON files.
limitations: Provides guidance only, does not execute matchms directly.
Chemical fingerprinting requires rdkit and matchms[chemistry] package.
Requires user to provide spectra files or USI references.

use_cases.title: Clean raw MS data
use_cases.description: Create a filtering pipeline to remove low quality spectra and normalize peaks.

use_cases.title: Match unknown spectra
use_cases.description: Score query spectra against a reference library using cosine or modified cosine.

use_cases.title: Design multi-metric scoring
use_cases.description: Combine cosine, neutral loss, and fingerprint similarity with weighted scores.

prompt_templates.title: Load and filter MGF
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a simple matchms pipeline to load an MGF file, apply default_filters, normalize intensities, and keep peaks above 0.01 relative intensity.

prompt_templates.title: Library matching
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a workflow to match query spectra to a reference MGF library using CosineGreedy with tolerance 0.1 and list the top 5 matches.

prompt_templates.title: Add losses scoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a pipeline that adds neutral losses and scores spectra with NeutralLossesCosine, including required metadata checks.

prompt_templates.title: Export cleaned data
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to clean spectra with quality filters and export the resulting spectra to both MGF and JSON files.

output_examples.input: Match my unknown spectra to a library with cosine scoring and show top hits.
output: Load library and query spectra from MGF files
List top 5 matches per query with compound names and scores

best_practices: Use generator-based loading for large spectral files to conserve memory.
Apply metadata harmonization before performing similarity scoring.
Validate precursor_mz presence when using modified cosine or neutral loss similarity.
anti_patterns: Scoring spectra without normalizing intensities first.
Using fingerprint similarity without SMILES or InChI metadata.
Ignoring None returns from quality control filters.

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it provides matchms guidance that works across those AI platforms.

faq.question: What are the file size limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your environment. Use generator-based loading for large datasets.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my Python pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, the workflows are designed for Python scripts and Jupyter notebooks.

faq.question: Does this skill access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No, it only uses file paths and data you explicitly provide in prompts.

faq.question: What if a filter returns None?
faq.answer: Check that required metadata exists and apply prerequisite filters before scoring.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic MS tools?
faq.answer: It focuses specifically on matchms APIs for reproducible spectral similarity workflows.
